review: one of the most relaxing and comforting game ive ever played sweet without being saccharin it can be a little jenky at times but less so than say oblivion a lot of love has clearly gone into this game
beautiful  peaceful game to play and relax
very good graphics very interesting calming
i enjoy slow paced game and exploration like this and i have not find any other games the way i enjoy eastshade hope the studio will make similar type of game

skyrim light the walking simulator  well i miss skyrim so i like it but you are a painter not a hero and you have a brush no sword everything looks nice and everyone is nice you can walk talk and explore a small beautiful world  a game for dark hours and when you need something nice

an rpg where combat is replaced by painting landscapes yes please the perfect anditode for players who feel like im too old for this sht and dont want to be stressed by an adventure game its fun to explore the beautiful island uncover secrets and solve npcs problems its so dang cozy and sweet
i still think about this game  ill replay one day

interesting novel game but frustrating clunky erroneous and randomly froze my pc whenever loading manually saved games while the game play and immersive graphics were its best features the game mechanics desperately need updating especially if the developers are still receiving 20 a pop on this ageing title
cant save right now
this game is underrated a cosy exploration game with lovely imagery  a peaceful soundtrack the game is slow paced  low energy perfect for when you want to unwind with limited brain power
this is a unique and gorgeous narrative puzzle game  highly recommended

it is a slow game but it is a great game you wander around this beautiful world doing random tasks that pop up when you meet new people and explore new locations its a perfect game to just chill and relax
i love the game but when i get so far and i want to save were i up to it states no saving please someone help me
nice and chill but with some nice surprises here and there a few technical issues but nothing saveruining for me did screw me out of a questrelated achievement but i dont care about those

beautiful relaxing game to enjoy at your leisure  the fetch quests get a little repetitive id like to see more canvas material and more incentivesrewards  after wandering around for a couple of hours doing errands for the town folk im not very motivated to continue

such a beautiful relaxing game it is so refreshing to play an rpg with no combat i am only a fraction though the game and i just look forward to who will be around the next corner id recommend to anyone seeking a truly relaxing moment to smell the flowers virtually i wish there were some key hints though sometimes i have activated a puzzle and trying to work out what button combo will break out of the situation i have found my self in would be rather helpful

peaceful relaxing and beautiful game i struggled with having enough inspiration at one point it wasnt until the end when i was choosing which pictures to best commemorate mother that i found out selecting one gives you a bunch of inspiration
pretty dope  made many a silly painting and practiced looking at the world with curiosity and beauty 1110

i hate to give a negative review for this game but i had terrible motion sickness while playing it this game is very beautiful the music is nice and the overall atmosphere is great too bad it didnt have more options for motion sickness also there are quite a lot of bugs sudden jumping when stuck in places made me even more dizzy
very fun

beautiful game that really allows for a lovely sense of discovery that ive never really experienced in a game before even though there are some quests to guide you it feels like you are simply exploring eastshade at your own pace meeting new people and finding out secrets just so relaxing
wonderful game it has a lot in common with an elder scrolls game but focuses in exploring the world as a painter it has a lot of charm and the character interactions make it a cute and fun experience

wow what a gem if you suffer from anxiety or depression then play this it is the most theraputic game ever known it is like time travel i played for 6 hours but could swear it was only 1 there is  a bug here and there though but nothing serious so long as you very frequently save which is no hassle at all so yeah i highly recommend this game

a chill quest based game with dynamic characters and an interesting world the game play is simple and once you get into the story its easy to immerse yourself within it it contains just enough drama to be interesting without getting too bogged down in the details grab a cup of tea and enjoy this cozy game

this game is beautiful it radiates an immense sense of calm and the aesthetics make me wish it could go on forever i finished the game with tears in my eyes not even because of any particular character but because of the full picture of this wonderful open world sometimes theres a bug or two but theyre honestly easily forgotten with how lovely this game is

im loving this game  i like that im not playing beat the clock to complete tasks  and i like that i dont have to defend myself from anything  its just a really pleasant experience and i like the beautiful scenery
amazing game with great atmosphere and beautiful scenery interesting game concept with the painting mechanics you will have great time exploring the island

wonderful game it took me about 20 hours to complete every quest this is exactly the kind of game i like openworld exploration with tasks the game is never scary or creepy which is something i am always concerned about i would say the plotlines are not made for young children so much to explore and do i love how you can actually make choices that affect the game a will play again

this game allows you to explore the island the way you see fit while doing some quests or commisions for the people on it   i really loved the fact that it was so utterly peaceful the people and their stories are fun theres quite a bit to do and the scenery is just so lovely which makes sense since youre supposed to paint some of it    it was really suitable for a gamer like me since the story and side quests are very low stakes meaning you cant die only fail a bit xd

a peaceful game about exploring the island of eastshade and learning the stories of the inhabitants and places there  its a little janky and rough around the edges but the world is full of details and charm if you can accept that the games age shows in things like lack of cloud saves and other quirks   if youre the kind of player that loves talking to every npc reading every book item and exploring just for the fun of it this game is a rare gem
love the scenery story music  a big fave

feels like youre a character in one of those novels from elementary school that you cant remember the name of especially all the little fun moments with the characters bojan is a legend overall a good experience would recommend
good game enjoyed every aspect of it
cooll game

incredible game with stunning visuals i enjoyed exploring the world of eastshade the characters are well thought out with many quests to complete there is a bit of walking and backandforth in this game but there are some mechanics to ease the travel time later on in the game i would say the game has plenty of replay potential even more so if you dont find all of the locations finish each quest or miss one of those candles 810
seemed like a nice looking peaceful game but the creepy npcs completely wrecked it for me
beautiful world peaceful music this game heals my soul
i absolutely adore this game i am a combat veteran with ptsd and this game gives me so much peace i own it on xbox and pc i wish there was a switch port so i could buy it again
beautiful calming game i really enjoyed the characters and their stories

it is beautiful and there really is no other game like it i loved it and will probably always remember it fondly as one of those gameplay experiences that just isnt like the others one of those games i wish i could play for the first time again

a game with goals but no pressure mysteries puzzles curious characters and wonderful scenery it is nice to be able to play a game with no pressure of dying at every turn it is a little light on explanationsinstructions but that is what community is for right 3

oh my goodness i cant even describe how much i love this game it takes the coziness and open world of skyrim and transforms it into something new i very rarely had to look up tutorials and i admit i did get emotional in the end overall a masterpiece and one of my new comfort games i cannot recommend this enough

one of those suprice indie games if you have even slight interest dont let it wait in your wishlist for 5 years just buy it and go blind  only problem i have with the game is it discourages you to paint stuff outside of quests since inspiration is very limited and you might hit a wall where you have to follow a very lineral path of quests to gain it like i did

absolutely beautiful walking simulator some of the environments in this game are 100 breathtaking the painting theme is also pretty unique in my opinion and i found myself just wanting to make paintings of every interesting thing i came across  the story is quite short but there are some enjoyable sidequests as well if you like beautiful walking simulators give this game a try
wow this was an otherworldly experience the scenery in the game was beautiful and it was for the most part a very relaxing experience i didnt want the game to end
bit rough around the edges but such a wonderful and gentle experience one of the only games that really forces you to stop and smell the roses
good game
beautiful game
if you want to walk around taking screenshots of a forest or just chill then this is a game to do it
kinda niche very cozy pretty colors and nice music  i only wish that the painting process was a bit more involved but all its a pretty awesome experience
very pretty and peaceful game

its like living a new life entirely relaxing and challenging plot at the same time
lovely game in every way

great chill game walk around paint beautiful landscapes help people stutters a bit 5700x3d 3080 but mostly alleviated by turning graphics down
one of the best cozy games ive played you get to explore the entire beautiful island and there are lots of quests to complete
its a great chill cosy game

definitely recommend to anyone who needs to run away from the real world and catch a breath or forget about stress and sadness eastshade is a place where people know that the true meaning of life is about tea poetry and enjoying the beauty of the world around them everyone is nice the sceneries of the island are amazing and your only quest is to enjoy i wish i could life there   setting and animation  easy game play  feelgood game   story   nothing
yes

im not exaggerating when i call this my comfort game getting to wander around beautiful scenery making friends helping others and capturing that scenery in paintings is the perfect kind of escapism i seek out when i need just a little bit of quiet and comfort in my life i will never stop recommending this game
peaceful
this game is relaxing

the good  really peaceful beautiful environments  good voiceacting   immersive   fun quests nice variety and often gives different approacheschoices you can make   what can be improved  no or not enough explanationtutorials about what you need to do  how some game mechanics work  journal quest entries can be vague leaving you unsure on how to progress   bugs quiiite a few of them save often
relaxing and enjoyable needed a bit more info than the game gave on two quests no big deal rest was great
i bought and played it immediately when it came out and loved it now ive played it again after 5 years and it holds up still its a beautiful and relaxing game
if you like collecting things and doing side quests then boy do i have a game for you

if you play adventure rpgs and enjoy the cosy sidequests as a breather from the stress of combat then this is the game for you eastshade is incredibly relaxing there is no rush to complete anything by specific times no fighting you go at your own pace and it is about impossible to get lost in what you should do next just follow one of the questlines
such a visually stunning game with lots of fun tasks and quests to complete has got to be in my top 10 of favorite games
genuinely a cozy game without the farming that is in every other cozy game its actually relaxing  plus absolutely luvvvv they have voice acting for everything
this game is beautiful with a interesting cast of characters lots of fun mini games and very relaxing music no matter your skill level this game has something for you

art is not what you see but what you make others feel  eastshade isnt just a game  its a peaceful journey of creativity and connection as an artist youre not just painting landscapes youre capturing the soul of a breathtaking world  the music the vibrant colors and the heartfelt stories make it feel like youre part of the canvas  every visit to eastshade feels like coming home

a beautiful game through and through

at first it appears a bit unappealing and pretty unpolished but i lost myself in the exploration and the many quests given by the inhabitants of the land i also got some good suprises and the fact that there is not markers and guides reminds me the charms of that old games where you were forced to think by yourself and search for solutions its a good and relaxing experience

i do love this game but ive been frustrated by the 10ish times in 7 hours of playing that the game has crashed or glitched out  this game is very enjoyable as an escapism simulator but its quite glitchy  i still recommend it it feels like skyrim snap complete with all the glitches and occasionally wonky physics

its shoddily put together with bugs pop ins ugly stiff characters and animations and the drops off after you reach the largest of the two cities however this game is also incredibly charming in a way that cannot be described and i have fallen in love with the world and the characters
an amazing and unique game if you want an open world rpg that does not focus on combat stats and numbergoup but instead on exploration story and senseofplace then you should definitely check this out
its a lovely game and i really enjoyed soaking in the wonderful atmosphere the developers really made it that basically everywhere you go will have a potentially beautiful painting

so beautiful peaceful and interesting  the music is fantastic  i think i cried several times in the first half hour just due to the beauty   so different than regular life i appreciate the five years the developer spent on this  it was totally worth it also appreciate the nods to tartaria and the mudflood  delightful   thank you

this is a gorgeous game with genuinely interesting quests and charming characters its so calming to play something open world that is not concerned with either combat or survival and that rewards rambling exploration i love this game to bits

i dont play a lot of games but decided to try this and was not disappointed its a cozy nonviolent and stressfree adventure game where you explore an island and make paintings as you go it was very relaxing to do at my own pace and rewarding to find new locations and complete quests for npcs i ran into a few glitches with quests not progressing or completing properly but restarting the game fixed it each time highly recommend
charming peaceful rpg with rewarding exploration
i adore this game

i enjoyed this beautiful game immensly to everyone who likes walking around a really beautifully crafted island with mysteries and hidden vistas and nonviolent adventure i recommend eastshade wholeheartedly

i found this game to be absolutely lovely and well worth every penny im normally a player of things like arma and war thunder and this was such a refreshing change of pace i would describe it as mindfulness in a game to be honest with a gorgeous soundtrack and world to explore cant recommend it enough
beautiful game with stunning music im addicted

quaint little game with beautiful graphics lots of fun adventures to go on and quests to do could see myself playing this game for a very long time

if you dig the art style and slow explorative gameplay you will like this game its a lot of talking moving around figuring stuff out and painting this is stuff i enjoy so im having a great time watch the trailer to get a sense of the art style and character art though most of the enjoyment of the game comes from the scenery and the landscape you get to explore so if you dont like how it looks you wont enjoy the game
a beautiful relaxing game i love it quite a few minor bugs unfortunately but absolutely worth it
